revised_title: Effect of High Energy X-Rays and Pile Radiation on the Thermal Decomposition and Thermal Explosion of Lead Azide
tldr: The authors studied the effect of high energy X-rays and pile radiation on the thermal decomposition and thermal explosion of lead azide. They found that radiation accelerates the decomposition process and reduces the time to explosion. The results indicate that radiation can sensitize lead azide to a thermal initiation method, such as a 'hot spot' produced by impact, friction, or needle prick.
